Package com.tyndalehouse.step.core.data.common

Class PartialDate

java.lang.Object
com.tyndalehouse.step.core.data.common.PartialDate
public class PartialDate extends Object
This class is the way dates are represented in the databased and they should be parsed back into this object on their way out! The date field indicates when the event (or start of the event) took place, the precision type indicates whether how much of the date can be trusted... This means we can store dates such as (01/03/1900, MONTH), meaning March 1900 (and not 1st March 1900).

    • parseDate

      public static PartialDate parseDate(String date)
      Date is specified in yy-mm-dd or yyyy-mm-dd and gets parsed in to a date. the mm and dd are optional which is what determines the precision of the date.
      Parameters:
      date - date to be parsed as a string
      Returns:
      a PartialDate
